item.title: Report E-2023090130
item.description:
Report E-2023090130

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, a vehicle drove through the coned off delivery area and hit the hose adaptor. This caused the connection between the hose adaptor and storage tank to become compromised. Approximately 10 gallons of gasoline was released. The Harris County Hazmat team responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking haz mat in a black bin was given to QA on belt 5, QA called me to inspect the haz mat. PPE used blue gloves, i placed the leaking hazmat in a lines red hazmat tote and opened it for inspection. One of the caps was loose on one of the gallon jugs causing an internal leak DescribePack: cap was not on tight DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed leaking hazmat into a lined red tote

item.title: Report I-2023080047
item.description:
Report I-2023080047

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-02
  • City: LONGVIEW
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PLAINS MARKETING LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Description: On July 2, 2023 at approximately 7:15 PM, a Plains transport driver with a load of crude oil was traveling southbound on State Highway 42 in Gregg County, TX. At the intersection of Hwy 42 and Texaco Rd, a 2012 Nissan traveling east on Texaco Rd failed to stop at a stop sign and collided with Plains transport, causing the tank trailer to separate from the tractor and roll over into the ditch. Upon separation, the landing gear broke off and punctured a 3x3 inch hole in the trailer, at the 7 o'clock position if upright, but upon roll over, puncture was located at the 10 o'clock position. As a result of the collision, 70 gallons of diesel from the transport fuel tank and approximately 2 gallons of hydraulic fluid, from the trailer hydraulic pump and lines, were released to the roadway and roadside ditch. The Plains vehicle and the other vehicle were non drivable and had to be towed from the scene. An absorbent was applied to the roadway to encapsulate the diesel and hydraulic fluid, then swept and contained in 55 gallon drums. The impacted roadside ditch has been excavated to remove impacted soil and manifested for disposal, in accordance with TCEQ clean-up criteria. . . The Plains employee was injured and treated at a medical facility. Occupant of other vehicle perished at the scene.

The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
